dialog: But if I don't pass, shall I expect to hear from you?
I'm afraid not. Give it a fortnight, if you don't receive a Howler, then I'm afraid it means your application was unsuccessful.
Then is there any hope for me getting this position?
I'm sorry, but the final decision is not in my hands, and I must confer with the other interviewing panel members.
Understood. Regardless of the outcome, I've gained much insight from our discussion.
A commendable outlook, well done.
Many thanks for offering me the chance to interview.
You're welcome, it was my pleasure.
I've a bit of a tummy ache.
Best you lie down then, a bit of rest is just what you need.
Very well, I shall.
What sort of personality would you say you have?
I'd say I'm quite active and full of energy. I tackle things with enthusiasm and don't like to leave a job half-done.
Would you consider yourself introverted or extroverted?
I'd say I'm quite outgoing, I enjoy socializing and doing things with others.
What do you believe is the most important factor in your happiness?
I firmly believe that having close friends is the key. One cannot live in solitude, after all. A true friend is a treasure indeed, and the more I have, the merrier I am.
What sort of people do you prefer to work alongside?
I value honesty, commitment, and integrity in my colleagues.

I'd like to take a moment to extend a warm welcome to Monica, our newest addition to the finance department. We've hired Monica for her expertise as a professional accountant, and I'm sure you'll all find her an asset to the team. With her extensive accounting experience, I'm positive you'll all learn from her.
